strengths: Edict ability — winning combat grants command tokens from opponents, scaling with player count
Imperia — stolen tokens grant access to enemy commander abilities
Flagship Arvicon Rex gives +2 attack vs opponents without tokens in your fleet pool
Multiple commander abilities via stolen tokens multiplies tactical options
weaknesses: Hubris forces purging alliance promissory notes — removes diplomatic flexibility
Entire strategy requires winning fights; extended peace makes you weaker
Capped at one token per opponent — cannot infinitely scale
Slow starter; needs combat early to get rolling
tips: Start conservatively while leveraging Bio-Stims and Predictive Intelligence (starting techs)
Target multiple opponents early with limited conflicts to gather tokens before retaliation
Prioritize Cruiser II given modest starting unit capacity
Use Imperia strategically — borrowed commander abilities can swing games
Flagship is most effective against players you haven't beaten yet (no token in your pool)
Win-rate has skyrocketed recently as players learn to leverage the token economy

techPaths.name: Mobility + Faction tech
techPaths.note: Cruiser II for mobility; faction tech for unit regeneration and voting control
